## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 327, 304, 344]]<|/det|>
Paper 5 Mechanics 2 (M2)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 370, 418, 386]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 392, 460, 408]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 418, 390, 435]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 448, 782, 464]]<|/det|>
Write your centre number, candidate number and name in the spaces at the top of this page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 464, 325, 479]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 479, 504, 495]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 495, 504, 510]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 510, 380, 525]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 539, 910, 570]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions in the space provided. If additional space is required, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet. The question number(s) must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 570, 910, 600]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 600, 724, 615]]<|/det|>
Where a numerical value for the acceleration due to gravity is needed, use \(10 \text{m s}^{- 2}\) .  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 615, 593, 630]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 630, 606, 645]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 658, 606, 673]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 674, 756, 689]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 689, 440, 704]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 50.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[280, 81, 756, 168]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 186, 920, 237]]<|/det|>
A particle \(P\) of mass \(0.3 \mathrm{~kg}\) is attached to a fixed point \(A\) by a light inextensible string of length \(0.8 \mathrm{~m}\). The fixed point \(O\) is \(0.15 \mathrm{~m}\) vertically below \(A\). The particle \(P\) moves with constant speed \(v \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{- 1}\) in a horizontal circle with centre \(O\) (see diagram).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 250, 156, 268]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 250, 500, 268]]<|/det|>
Show that the tension in the string is \(16 \mathrm{~N}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 250, 918, 268]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 526, 143, 543]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 526, 316, 543]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(v\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 526, 920, 543]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
A particle is projected with speed \(V \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{- 1}\) at an angle of \(\theta^{\circ}\) above the horizontal. At the instant 4 s after projection the speed of the particle is \(16 \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{- 1}\) and its direction of motion is \(30^{\circ}\) above the horizontal. Find \(V\) and \(\theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[319, 83, 717, 242]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 260, 920, 327]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the cross-section through the centre of mass of a uniform solid object. The object is a cylinder of radius \(0.2 \text{m}\) and length \(0.7 \text{m}\), from which a hemisphere of radius \(0.2 \text{m}\) has been removed at one end. The point \(A\) is the centre of the plane face at the other end of the object. Find the distance of the centre of mass of the object from \(A\). [5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 339, 428, 359]]<|/det|>
[The volume of a hemisphere is \(\frac{2}{3}\pi r^3\).]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
A small ball is projected with speed \(25 \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{- 1}\) at an angle of \(30^{\circ}\) above the horizontal from a point \(O\) on horizontal ground. At time \(t\) s after projection the horizontal and vertically upwards displacements of the ball from \(O\) are \(x \mathrm{~m}\) and \(y \mathrm{~m}\) respectively.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 135, 156, 153]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 134, 831, 153]]<|/det|>
Express \(x\) and \(y\) in terms of \(t\) and hence find the equation of the trajectory of the ball.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 135, 920, 153]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 918, 107]]<|/det|>
A force of magnitude \(12 \mathrm{N}\) is applied along the edge \(AC\) of the lamina in the direction from \(A\) towards \(C\). The lamina, still suspended at \(B\), is now in equilibrium with \(AB\) vertical.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 153, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 120, 438, 138]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 153, 92]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
